item.title: Short CV
item.description:
Research Interests

  • PFAS–microplastic interactions and aging
  • Environmental fate and transport in soils and aquatic systems
  • Mechanistic toxicology and membrane transport
  • Reactive transport modeling (DOM–MP–PFAS interactions)
  • Advanced treatment technologies (bio-membranes, ultrafiltration benchmarking)
  • Multiscale molecular modeling (MD, DFT) integrated with descriptor-based frameworks

Education

Ph.D. in Environmental Engineering
University of Connecticut, Storrs, CT
2021 – Present (Expected June 2026)
Dissertation: Mechanistic Interactions, Environmental Mobility, and Toxicological Impacts of PFAS–Microplastic Co-Contaminants

Doctor of Medicine (M.D.)
Université Paris-Saclay, France
2025
Focus: Exposure pathways, toxicology, and public health

M.Eng. in Bioengineering
National Polytechnic School / Sorbonne University, France & Algeria
2018

Engineer, Process & Environmental Engineering
National Polytechnic School / Sorbonne University
2018

Professional Experience

University of Connecticut – Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering
Research Assistant (2021 – Present)

  • Lead experimental and modeling studies on PFAS–microplastic interactions
  • Designed sorption, aging, toxicity, and soil-column transport experiments
  • Developed descriptor-based mechanistic frameworks
  • Conducted MD/DFT simulations of interfacial energetics
  • Coordinated interdisciplinary collaborations

JGC Group, Yokohama, Japan
Process Engineer (2020 – 2021)

  • Process system d
